intro: Tephrosia perriniana, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Its roots contain compounds that have been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Tephrosia perriniana is also notable for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
